        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Adjustment indicator</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">Adjustment indicator is a statistical technique used to remove the effects of seasonal and calendar influences operating on a data series.

        <structure:Code id="_Z">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not applicable</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="T">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Trend</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="C">

        <structure:Code id="R">

        <structure:Code id="K">

        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="X">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Seasonal component</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Synonyms: Seasonal effects; seasonal factors</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Seasonal and calendar components</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Synonyms: Seasonal and calendar effects; seasonal and calendar factors</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="I">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Irregular component</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Synonym: Irregular effects</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="N">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Neither seasonally adjusted nor calendar adjusted data</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Synonyms: Raw data; unadjusted data</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Seasonally adjusted data, not calendar adjusted</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Calendar adjusted data, not seasonally adjusted</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Y">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Calendar and seasonally adjusted data</common:Name>

        <structure:Code id="GOOE">

          <common:Description xml:lang="en">GOTEG=GOTEE+P5NP</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>

          <common:Description xml:lang="en">GOTEE=GD1+GP2+P51M+GD41+D3+DG+GD6M+GOOE</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>

          <common:Description xml:lang="en">GOTEEG=GD1+GP2+GD41+D3+DG+GD6M+GOOE</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="GOTR">

          <common:Description xml:lang="en">GOTR=ODA+GD61+DG+GOOR</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="GP1">

        </structure:Code>

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Sales by market establishments</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">GP11=P11-P118-P119</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="GP2">

          <common:Description xml:lang="en">GP2=P2-P28-P29-P5OA2</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="GP51C">

          <common:Description xml:lang="en">GP51C=P51C-P5OA3</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="IN">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Primary and secondary income</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">IN=D1+D2+D3+D4+D5+D6+D7+D8;
IN=IN1+IN2</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Primary income</common:Name>

        </structure:Code>

        </structure:Code>

          <common:Description xml:lang="en">IN22=IN2-D752</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>

        </structure:Code>

      <structure:Codelist id="CL_OBS_STATUS" agencyID="ESTAT" version="2.3" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation status</common:Name>
        <structure:Code id="A">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Normal value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used as default value if no value is provided or when no special coded qualification is assumed. Usually, it can be assumed that the source agency assigns sufficient confidence to the provided observation and/or the value is not expected to be dramatically revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="B">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Time series break</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observations are characterised as such when different content exists or a different methodology has been applied to this observation as compared with the preceding one (the one given for the previous period).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Definition differs</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate slight deviations from the established methodology (footnote-type information); these divergences do not imply a break in time series.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="E">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Estimated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation obtained through an estimation methodology (e.g. to produce back-casts) or based on the use of a limited amount of data or ad hoc sampling and through additional calculations (e.g. to produce a value at an early stage of the production stage while not all data are available). It may also be used in case of experimental data (e.g. in the context of a pilot ahead of a full scale production process) or in case of data of (anticipated/assessed) low quality. If needed, additional information can be provided through free text using the COMMENT_OBS attribute at the observation level or at a higher level. This code is to be used when the estimation is done by a sender agency. When the imputation is carried out by a receiver agency in order to replace or fill gaps in reported data series, the flag to use is I "Value imputed by a receiving agency".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="F">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Forecast value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Value deemed to assess the magnitude which a quantity will assume at some future point of time (as distinct from "estimated value" which attempts to assess the magnitude of an already existent quantity).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="G">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Experimental value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Data collected on the basis of definitions or (alternative) collection methods under development. Data not of guaranteed quality as normally expected from provider.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; holiday or weekend</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used in some daily data flows.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="I">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Value imputed by a receiving agency</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation imputed by a receiving agency to replace or fill gaps in reported data series. This code is intended to cover all cases where a receiving agency publishes data about a sending agency that do not come from an official source in the sender agency's reporting framework. When the estimation is done by the sender agency, the flag to use is E "Estimated value".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="J">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Derogation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Clause in an agreement (e.g. legal act, gentlemen's agreement) stating that some provisions in the agreement are not to be implemented by designated parties; these derogations may affect the observation or cause a missing value. In general, derogations are limited in time.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="K">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Data included in another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data for a given category are missing and are included in another category, sub-total or total. Generally where code "K" is used there should be a corresponding code "W - Includes data from another category" assigned to the over-covered category. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify under which category the data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="L">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data exist but were not collected</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when some data are not reported/disseminated because they are below a certain threshold.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data cannot exist</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to denote empty cells resulting from the impossibility to collect a statistical value (e.g. a particular education level or type of institution may be not applicable to a given country's education system).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="N">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not significant</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate a value which is not a "real" zero (e.g. a result of 0.0004 rounded to zero).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="O">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is to be used when no breakdown is made between the reasons why data are missing. Data can be missing due to many reasons: data cannot exist, data exist but are not collected (e.g. because they are below a certain threshold or subject to a derogation clause), data are unreliable, etc.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Provisional value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">An observation is characterised as "provisional" when the source agency - while it bases its calculations on its standard production methodology - considers that the data, almost certainly, are expected to be revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; suppressed</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when data are suppressed due to statistical confidentiality considerations.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Strike and other special events</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Special circumstances (e.g. strike) affecting the observation or causing a missing value.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="U">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Low reliability</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This indicates existing observations, but for which the user should also be aware of the low quality assigned.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="V">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unvalidated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation as received from the respondent without further evaluation of data quality.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Includes data from another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data include another category, or go beyond the scope of the data collection and are therefore over-covered. Generally, where code "W" is used there should be a corresponding code "K - Data included in another category" assigned to the category which is under-covered. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify which additional data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="R">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Revised value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">An observation is marked as revised when previously transmitted data are changed to inform the users that there has been a change. An additional comment (e.g. through the COMMENT_OBS attribute) may provide information on the change. To be used in Price statistics.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>

      <structure:Codelist id="CL_CONF_STATUS" agencyID="SDMX" version="1.3" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Confidentiality Status</common:Name>
        <structure:Code id="A">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Primary confidentiality due to small counts</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="C">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Confidential statistical information</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Secondary confidentiality set by the sender, not for publication</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="E">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not for publication, restricted for internal use only (equivalent to the code N) until the embargo time elapses; Free for publication (equivalent to the code F) after the embargo time elapses.</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="F">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Free (free for publication)</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="G">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Primary confidentiality due to dominance by one or two units</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Primary confidentiality due to data declared confidential based on other measures of concentration</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="N">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not for publication, restricted for internal use only</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="O">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Primary confidentiality due to dominance by one unit</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Secondary confidentiality set and managed by the receiver, not for publication</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="T">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Primary confidentiality due to dominance by two units</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="X">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Confidentiality due to military secrecy</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>

      <structure:Codelist isPartial="true" id="CL_FREQ" agencyID="SDMX" version="2.0" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Frequency</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code list provides a set of values indicating the "frequency" of the data (e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly). The concept “frequency” may refer to various stages in the production process, e.g. data collection or data dissemination. For example, a time
          series could be disseminated at annual frequency but the underlying data are compiled monthly. The code list is applicable for all different uses of "frequency". This code list was formally adopted on 4 December 2013. More information about and supporting material for this code list and
          SDMX code lists in general (e.g. list of generic codes for expressing general concepts like "Total", "Unknown", etc.; syntaxes for the creation of further codes; general guidelines for the creation of SDMX code lists) can be found at this address:
          https://sdmx.org/?page_id=4345.</common:Description>
        <structure:Code id="Q">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quarterly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated every quarter.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
      <structure:Codelist id="CL_TIME_FORMAT" agencyID="SDMX" version="1.0" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Time Format</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code list provides coded information (based on the ISO 8601 standard) indicating the type of time references used in the data. It was released in 2009. More information about this code list and SDMX code lists in general (e.g. list of generic codes for expressing general concepts like "Total", "Unknown", etc.; syntaxes for the creation of further codes; general guidelines for the creation of SDMX code lists) can be found at this address: https://sdmx.org/?page_id=4345.</common:Description>
        <structure:Code id="P1D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Daily (or Business)</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used only in SDMX-ML messages</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P1M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Monthly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used only in SDMX-ML messages</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P1Y">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Annual</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used only in SDMX-ML messages</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P3M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quarterly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used only in SDMX-ML messages</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P6M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Half-yearly, semester</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used only in SDMX-ML messages</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P7D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Weekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used only in SDMX-ML messages</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="PT1M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Minutely</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used only in SDMX-ML messages</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="203">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYMMDDhhmm</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for series with freq. higher than daily) year/month/day/hours/minutes</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="102">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYMMDD</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for daily and business series) year/month/day</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="616">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYWW</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for weekly series) year/week</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="610">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYMM</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for monthly series) year/month</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="608">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYQ</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for quarterly series) year/quarter</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="604">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYS</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for half yearly series) year/semester</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="602">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYY</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for annual series) year</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="719">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYMMDDhhmmCCYYMMDDhhmm</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for series with freq. higher than daily) year/month/day/hours/minutes to year/month/day/hours/minutes</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="711">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYMMDDCCYYMMDD</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for daily and business series) from year/month/day to year/month/day</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="716">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYWWCCYYWW</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for weekly series) from year/week to year/week</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="710">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYMMCCYYMM</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for monthly series) from year/month to year/month</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="708">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYQCCYYQ</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for quarterly series) from year/quarter to year/quarter</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="704">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYSCCYYS</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for half yearly series) from half-year to half-year</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="702">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">CCYYCCYY</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">(Used in SDMX-EDI for annual series) from year to year</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
